title: Infernal high ping
body: Today i lost 3 games due to the high ping. My ms was around 90-100, pretty high number but thats how it is all the time and usually the game runs smoothly. My fps was affected though, from 80-90 at down to 45, but that shouldnt be a problem here, its pretty playable at that number. More exactly the issue is the game delay, like...i right click to buy an item and nothing happens until 3 sec or until i press again or after few rage clicks, or clicking to move the champion the same way, and in general moving everywhere with high delay....

replies.body: You're right in thinking that this isn't really an fps or ping issue exactly, but this does seem to be a specific type of network-based issue. Packet Loss can cause things like stutters or delayed actions or movements as well. It'd be good to check first before jumping to conclusions though, so be sure to run a traceroute to our EUNE servers at 31.186.224.42 to see how your connection is looking on it's way to our servers. Be sure to post those results here so I can take a look as well.
I've played all my games for the last about 8 years with 120-200 ping, with 180 being the current average. I'd say below 60 fps is noticeable. I run perfect'y smooth with 180 ping and 200 fps.

> [{quoted}](name=Kokua,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=28f5lEMU,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-12-28T17:21:10.760+0000)
>
> I've played all my games for the last about 8 years with 120-200 ping, with 180 being the current average. I'd say below 60 fps is noticeable. I run perfect'y smooth with 180 ping and 200 fps.

You know how its like to play a game with ping?(delay) Its not fps drop, its like clicking to move the champ to a tower, and if you change direction you still walk some mettres to that tower before actually moving away. Thats why i said its not the fps.

Sounds more like packet loss if your ping isn't spiking higher than 90-100 like you're saying, and yes, I've had that issue. You can upload some of your recent games to the [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) and see what they can tell you. You can also check for [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) if you believe your ping to be the problem.
